duties_responsibilities.duty: Services and repairs automotive systems, including brakes, electrical, engine performance, engine repair, heating/air conditioning, suspension/steering, transmissions, and axles.
Performs customer and vehicle service, including road tests, inspections, mechanical diagnoses, and explaining needed repairs.
Maintains service center standards of cleanliness and orderliness, reviews tool and equipment maintenance, and complies with safety policies.
Performs tire deliveries, tire service, oil changes, alignments, and fluid services, while adhering to physical demands and environmental conditions.
Meets minimum qualifications, including basic mechanical tasks, vocational-technical education, and valid driver's license with automotive repair experience.

education_certification.credential: Valid automobile driver’s license and minimum 2 years of automotive repair experience, completion of Vocational-Technical School program in a related field, or demonstrated skills via third-party certificates/assessment. A.S.E. certification in at least one of A1-A8 is preferred.
